title: POGIL-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Engineering Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding fundamental principles of engineering education and possessing foundational knowledge in instructional design
context.additional_context: Enhancing Engineering Problem-Solving Instructional Design Competencies Using the POGIL Methodology for Pre-Service and In-Service Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can create instructional designs that solve complex engineering problems by applying the POGIL (Process-Oriented Guided Inquiry Learning) methodology.
Learners can compare and analyze theoretical predictions of engineering design projects with actual implementations through team-based collaborative learning.
Learners develop the ability to derive core questions in the engineering design process through literature and technical resource analysis.
Learners can analyze the impact of POGIL application on achieving program outcomes (POs) through self-assessment.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
